name: Transatlantic Consumer Dialogue
goal: The Transatlantic Consumer Dialogue (TACD) is a forum of US and EU consumer organisations which develops and agrees on joint consumer policy recommendations to the US government and European Union to promote the consumer interest in EU and US policy making.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Competition, Consumers, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Institutional affairs, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives:
EU initiatives and policies in the fields of Food, Intellectual Property, Information Society, Financial Services, Product Safety, Chemicals and Emerging Technologies

Negotiations of the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership (TTIP) (currently on hold)
